texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Some users will want to parse HTML through the PHP parser because one of their applications requires it, or because they think it's a good idea. Parsing regular static content through PHP is not recommended as it will cause a performance hit on the server each time a static page is loaded.
texts.text: Some users will want to parse HTML through the PHP parser because one of their applications requires it, or because they think it's a good idea. Parsing regular static content through PHP is not recommended as it will cause a performance hit on the server each time a static page is loaded.

texts.text: Unfortunately, enabling this in conjunction with Plesk will cause problems with the Plesk web statistics. Since the PHP parsing is disabled for the

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: directories, Apache will mark the page as a PHP page and your browser will attempt to download it rather than display it.
texts.text: directories, Apache will mark the page as a PHP page and your browser will attempt to download it rather than display it.

texts.text: as text/html rather than application/x-http-php. Your web statistics will display in the browser rather than downloading as a PHP file.
